legal.integration.content:
Overview

This guide provides a basic overview of how to integrate with Nexus Support Hub. Integration is mainly via our RESTful API, allowing you to create, read, update, and delete (CRUD) support tickets.

Authentication

Each API request must be authenticated using an API key you can generate from your Manager dashboard. The key must be included in the request header as follows:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

Create a ticket

To create a new ticket, make a POST request to the /api/v1/tickets endpoint with a JSON body containing the ticket details.

{
  "title": "Printer issue",
  "description": "The printer on the 3rd floor is not responding.",
  "priority": "High",
  "user_email": "user@example.com"
}

1. Data Collection

We collect information you provide directly, such as your name, email address, and support ticket content. This data is necessary to provide and improve the service.

2. Data Use

Your data is used exclusively for support ticket management, improving our AI assistant, and communicating with you. We do not sell or share your personal data with third parties for marketing purposes.

3. Your Rights

In accordance with GDPR, you have the right to access, rectify, delete, and port your data. You can exercise these rights by contacting our support at the address in the Intellectual Property section.
legal.privacy.title: Privacy Policy (GDPR Compliant)
legal.security.content:
Request Limits (Rate Limiting)

To ensure service stability for all clients, API requests are limited to 100 requests per minute per API key. If you exceed this limit, you will receive a 429 status code response.

Data Security

All data between your client and our servers is encrypted using TLS 1.2 or higher. Passwords are hashed and salted, and sensitive data at rest is encrypted. We regularly conduct security audits to ensure your information is protected.
legal.security.title: Limits & Security Information
legal.sla.content:
Service Level Agreement (SLA)

We commit to 99.9% service availability for our Professional and Enterprise plans. Availability is calculated monthly, excluding planned maintenance. If this commitment is not met, service credits may be applied.

Technical Support

Support is available via the application's ticket system. Response times vary by plan:

  • Basic: Response within 24 business hours.
  • Professional: Response within 8 business hours.
  • Enterprise: Response within 4 hours, 24/7 for critical issues.

presentation.title: Discover Nexus Support Hub
presentation.description: Nexus Support Hub is a help desk platform that blends AI, ticket management, and a knowledge base to relieve teams from Level 1 requests.

problems.title: What Nexus fixes in practice
problems.intro: Nexus was designed from real situations in IT and customer support teams:
items: Too many repetitive L1 tickets: access requests, password resets, simple procedures, FAQ questions.
Agents drowning in emails or forms with no clear ticket structure.
Time lost on qualification: every agent rereads the full history before acting.
Hard to keep a FAQ alive that users consult on their own.
Need for an accessible tool (keyboard, screen readers, contrast) following best practices without a heavy custom project.
problems.conclusion: With Nexus, AI consults your FAQ and internal content first, provides an immediate answer when possible, then creates a summarized, prioritized ticket when a human needs to step in.
